channel.title: 317, need some help
channel.description:
Grr
I need a few questions answered
How can i move objects around (weekest one) and what file are they in? For example theres a ancients altar by the rock crabs i want removed.
Second, how can i change the hp of a npc.
THIRD How can i change a portals tele coords, ex, portal teles you to 1000 1000, how can i make it tele you to coords 1938 2938
meh, dont laugh!

item.title: 317, need some help
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

The moparscape client will tell you the model ID of all objects and items, otherwise search around for a list.

Read full topic

item.title: 317, need some help
item.dc:creator: @rune-pure rune-pure
item.description:
@rune-pure wrote:

Err the moparscape client dosnt have the model of it, or does it?

Read full topic

item.title: 317, need some help
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“rune-pure, post:5, topic:282142”][quote author=Newty link=topic=372801.msg2813171#msg2813171 date=1244128854]

  1. Search for the object ID, then delete the line that says “addglobalobject(”

  2. Probably the NPC config file, no idea though.

  3. Look for the portal object id, then find where it teles you. It will look something like:

if (objectId == portalId) {
toX = Xcoord;
toY = Ycoord;
}

[/quote]

Damn newty your quick, through where would you get the id of a custom object?[/quote]

Just use the moparscape client and right click the object, that will give you the ID.

Read full topic

  1. Probably the NPC config file, no idea though.

  2. Look for the portal object id, then find where it teles you. It will look something like:

if (objectId == portalId) { toX = Xcoord; toY = Ycoord; } [/quote]

item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

  1. Search for the object ID, then delete the line that says “addglobalobject(”

  2. Probably the NPC config file, no idea though.

  3. Look for the portal object id, then find where it teles you. It will look something like:

toX = Xcoord;
toY = Ycoord;

item.title: 317, need some help
item.dc:creator: @XRangdaltonX XRangdaltonX
item.description:
@XRangdaltonX wrote:

1.look in client .java for item id and where its at and delete that line,but if you want to move it then change the coords.
3.look in client.java for where the portal teles you and change the coords (it will say case (portal item id))

Read full topic
